chargeHist.descr: Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

On one or more charges in this case, Darlene M Spears was found not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect. The defendant was found guilty of actually committing the crime(s) charged, but was also found not to be legally responsible under Wis. Stats. 971.165 for committing the crime(s) because of the defendant's mental condition. The legal effect of a finding of not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect is that the court must commit the defendant to the custody of the Department of Health and Family Services.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty but Not Guilty Due to Mental Disease/Defect

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty but Not Guilty Due to Mental Disease/Defect

09:04 AM Defendant Darlene M Spears in court, in custody, with attorney Joseph James Dorlack.   Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called to address issues with conditional release.  Defendant had filed a motion for early realease from probation.  State filed a motion to revoke conditional release.  State calls Agent Shannon Stydahar-Schulz to the stand.  Agent Stydahar-Schulz sworn in and testified on direct examination and cross examination.  Exhibit 1 marked, offered and received by the Court.    Court takes recess at 9:56.  Hearing resumed at 10:21.  Agent Stydahar-Schulz continued testifying on cross examination, redirect and recross.  Exhibits 2-4 marked, offered and received by the Court.  State rests.  Defense calls Glorielsie Velazquez to the stand.  Ms. Velazquez sworn in and testified on direct examination and cross examination.  Court takes recess at 10:52.  Hearing resumed at 11:01.  Defense calls Dr. Marie Raine to testify by phone.  Dr. Raine sworn in and testified on direct examination and cross examination.  Court takes recess at 11:20.  Hearing resumed at 11:40.  Defense calls Amber Ellis to testify by phone.  Ms. Ellis sworn in and testified on direct examination and cross examination.  Defense calls Agent Stydahar-Schulz to the stand.  Agent Stydahar-Schulz acknowledges she is still under oath and testifies on direct examination.  Defense rests.  No rebuttal by the State.  Testimony and evidence closed.  Closing arguments by the State.  Closing arguments by the Defense.  For the reasons stated on the record the Court denies the State's Petition to Revoke Conditional Release.  Defendant to be returned to Winnebago Mental Health Institution while a new conditional release plan is made.  Court will set a date for the hearing.  If the report is completed early the hearing may be moved up.  Review hearing scheduled for January 11, 2019 at 09:00 am.
